issues.title: Some DS components are busted
issues.body:
Some of our DS components are busted and will post errors similar to the following:

```
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ice.nek5000 4 0 2017-02-15 09:26:53.568
!MESSAGE [org.eclipse.ice.nek5000.VizServiceFactoryHolder(104)] doFindMethod: Suitable but non-accessible method found in class org.eclipse.ice.nek5000.internal.VizServiceFactoryHolder

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ice.nek5000 4 0 2017-02-15 09:26:53.568
!MESSAGE [org.eclipse.ice.nek5000.VizServiceFactoryHolder(104)] findMethod: Suitable but non-accessible method setVizServiceFactory found in class org.eclipse.ice.nek5000.internal.VizServiceFactoryHolder, subclass of org.eclipse.ice.nek5000.internal.VizServiceFactoryHolder

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ice.nek5000 4 0 2017-02-15 09:26:53.568
!MESSAGE [org.eclipse.ice.nek5000.VizServiceFactoryHolder(104)] bind method [setVizServiceFactory] not found; Component will fail

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ice.nek5000 4 0 2017-02-15 09:26:53.569
!MESSAGE [org.eclipse.ice.nek5000.VizServiceFactoryHolder(104)] bind method [setVizServiceFactory] not found
```

This problem is caused by updates to bndtools that were included in Apache Felix which has in turn been picked up by Equinox, c.f. - https://github.com/bndtools/bnd/issues/486. The source of the error in ICE (and EAVP) is that we are using static setters to store services. Fixing this is as simple as removing the static access modifier and replacing any instances of something like

```java
MyServiceHolder.set(foo);
```
with
```java
MyServiceHolder holder = new MyServiceHolder();
holder.set(foo);
```

These are, in fact, very good changes for us to make because creating our own singletons to store services has always been one of our sources of technical debt. In this case, all of ICE's various fields for storing such services are static because of our inheritance model, but access to them should not be.

Came across this problem with Sam the other day: 

It appears that ICE (and any Java app) on Mac OS X does not by default read in the current users shell environment variables. Sam tried to invoke the Moose and Libmesh build targets in ICE, and it failed because variables like PETSC_DIR were not set. This bug is Eclipse wide it appears [#490816](https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=490816). That bug references other links discussing this problem 

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/829749/launch-mac-eclipse-with-environment-variables-set/36282543

http://apple.stackexchange.com/questions/51677/how-to-set-path-for-finder-launched-applications

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/30118905/read-path-variable-using-java-in-eclipse-on-mac-os-x-differs-from-shell/36282645#36282645

Geometry Editor now keeps Properties View

issues.title: Giving focus to 3D editors blanks the Properties View
issues.body: The Geometry and Mesh Editors can only display the Properties View for their data while the Shapes or Mesh Elements View, respectively, have focus. This means the user has to click back to the tree view to reopen the properties every time they interact with the graphical canvas.

I have removed all of the require bundle statements in a new branch called jay/rap. I fixed many bugs, but unfortunately there is some real weirdness now. The tests fail on the build and junit plugin tests hang in the workbench. The latter might compete for a single test after three minutes. 

The best that I can think of is that the lack of strict requirements of bundles is causing the dependent chain to appear too shallow do that dependencies are not loaded. Of course, it is possible that these are not related, so I need a clearer test or set of tests.

I am going to check the workbench problems by running the same tests from a clean workspace using the next branch. Then, I'll do the same with the jay/rap tests. If the tests from next work, then I'll know I haven't encountered a workbench bug and my problem is with dependency loading. If that is true, fixing the Tycho build problems will be straightforward after finding the dependencies that fixed the junit plugin tests in the workbench.
issues.title: Build is hosed in jay/rap and junit plugin tests in workbench fail

issues.body:
We need to add support in the client for connecting to a remote core.

Once upon a time we had this in the "ConnectCoreAction." Perhaps we can reenable that button? I don't think we will need to use the remote core proxy though because the OSGI remote service infrastructure should be encapsulating all of that.

Instead of only having the button and manually switching, it would be nice to actually create view that listed all of the remote cores that are connected to the client.

This is to support Ram's request in #261.

issues.title: Default workspace location
issues.body: I'm confused about the workspace location settings. The product configuration sets osgi.instance.area.default=@user.home/Documents/workspace, but the launch arguments specify "-data @noDefault". The upshot is that (for OS X anyway), the workspace location ends up being inside the application bundle. I tried removing the "-data" argument and it works properly. I'm assuming that the "-data" option was so that the user would be forced to choose a new workspace when launching an instance. Is that correct?

We need to update the Item generation stuff and remove use of java.nio.file. We should be using IFile, IProject, etc from org.eclipse.core.resources. That way updates to files are handled correctly when we do a project.refreshLocal()

Hello all,

This was submitted by John Eblen at our ORNL Eclipse User Group Meeting today.

I attempted to follow the tutorial at [the wiki](https://wiki.eclipse.org/Using_Nek5000_with_ICE). After launching the job, I received the following standard error output:

Log of standard error collected by ICE for Nek5000 Launcher 2
Job launch date: 20160609_124716
Launch host: UltraFluffy

In the ICE Item Project Creation Wizard, if the project name is set to include capital letters, the project will have build errors due to inconsistent capitalization. The manifest and java files will include capital letters in their package names, but the package names themselves are all in lower case.

The wizard should either apply a single capitalization scheme or prevent the user from inputting capital letters in the project name.
issues.title: Project Generation capitalization inconsistency

When performing a remote job launch with ICE on a Mac, if the General > Security > Secure Storage > OS X Key Store Integration is checked ( which it unfortunately is by default ), then the Remote Services stuff cannot create a remote connection.

Under the CentOS operating system, attempting several functions related to Git will briefly freeze ICE, preventing the user from doing anything except moving or minimizing/maximizing the current window, followed shortly by ICE crashing.

Steps to reproduce:
Crash 1) In the Git perspective, press the Clone Git Repository button. Select Clone URI then hit Next.
Crash 2) When a repository is already in the Git perspective, right click, choose Import Projects, and press Next. 

I have tested vanilla Eclipse and Git worked fine in CentOS, so this is definitely a problem with ICE.

<whatever it should be>"

issues.body:
Due to the process of creating new items a null pointer exception may be thrown when using items created via the Item Creation wizard.  Things such as the custom action string, item name, and item description should not be set in the constructor, but rather in either the class itself or the setupItemInfo() method to avoid this issue.

Edit: Setting these in the setupItemInfo() method is the correct place.
issues.title: Newly added actionItems must be assigned as class variables or in setupItemInfo()

issues.body:
In the org.eclipse.ice.triquetrum.model.TriquetrumWorkflowItemModel, reviewEntries() returns null. 
If this is the case by default for generated item templates, the issues may occur as described below. I guess the reviewEntries() method should by default return a valid status, similar to what was mentioned in #122 ?

Related to this, a possible small improvement to avoid the NPEs that I saw : 
The NPEs were caused by comparing the form status similar to the following : 
`if (!status.equals(FormStatus.NeedsInfo))`
where status is null due to the above. 

It might be better to reverse the equals() order to something like : 
`if(!FormStatus.NeedsInfo.equals(status))`
i.e. put the constant/enum value first, which would avoid the NPEs.

---

issues.body:
Newly created Items that were generated with the project generator do not need to redeclare ioService as shown below. Developers can obtain that locally by calling the getIOService() operation on the base class.

Redeclaring the variable leads to scope problems and could result in null pointer exceptions.
issues.title: Newly created Items do not need to redeclare ioService

issues.body: The new project generator creates Models that do not extend Model.java, but instead extend Item.java. This in turn breaks ICE when ICE tries to load databases into the Model.
issues.title: Newly created Models do not extend Model and break ICE.

issues.body:
The newly generated Items created by the project generator do not include 

form = new Form();

in their setupForm() operations. This causes a null pointer exception at Item.java:532. 

Two things need to be fixed. First, all new setupForm() operations should include the line of code above. It is a rule that all newly created Items in ICE be launchable. (Check the docs.) Second, the Item needs to be updated to check the form to make sure it isn't null. The simplest way to fix this is to move the check for the action list into the if statement that checks if the form is null at line Item.java:537.
issues.title: Newly created Items are not immediately viewable and break ICE

issues.body:
Newly created projects using the project generator do not run and break ICE when it is launched. This is because the package name for the Launcher and Model builders is incorrect. For example, the code will put this in the class value of plugin.xml:

org.eclipse.ice.triquetrum.TriquetrumWorkflowItemLauncherBuilder

but that class is actually in 

org.eclipse.ice.triquetrum.launcher.TriquetrumWorkflowItemLauncherBuilder

which differs by the addition of "launcher." after "triquetrum."

Attempting to run a plugin generated with this results in catastrophic errors that prevent the ICE core from loading. For example,

issues.body: Items generated with the project generator create plugins that cannot compile correctly because they are missing imports on org.eclipse.core.runtime and org.eclipse.core.runtime.jobs. All generated Items should import these packages.
issues.title: Unresolved package imports in generated Items

issues.body: Items created by our new project generator should export the Launcher and Model packages. They are not currently exported.
issues.title: Generated Items missing package exports

issues.body: The "Specify ICE Item parameters" window has issues. First, "Class Base Name" is not sufficiently explanatory for new users. This should say something like "Item Class Name: " and it should have a tool tip with a description that fits what it is. Second, the work "parameters" in the title should be capitalized like the rest of the window. Third, a header that runs across the gray (lower) part of the text saying something like "Please configure these custom parameters for your ICE plugin" would help explain what this screen is for.
issues.title: The "Specify ICE Item parameters" window is too stark

The linux-x86_64 version of ICE found at http://eclipseice.ornl.gov/downloads/ice/stable-nightly/latest/ has Equinox issues.  They can be seen in several ways:

17:33:52.325 [Thread-175] INFO  o.e.ice.item.action.JobLaunchAction - JobLaunchAction copying launchJob_20151214053326.sh to local job launch folder: /Users/aqw/iceworkspace/moose_test_project/jobs/iceLaunch_20151214053352.
